title: The Latest Update On ‘The Thursday Murder Club 2' On Netflix
description: Will there be a Thursday Murder Club sequel on Netflix? A Thursday Murder Club 2? Here are the latest updates on that front.
content:
The Thursday Murder Club recently entertained my parents quite a bit, as they actually called me to tell me to watch it, so clearly it has found at least some level of an audience. Now, we turn to the idea of a sequel, The Thursday Murder Club 2, albeit it wouldn’t be called that. Here are all the latest updates that we have, including the latest:
• The film is based on the first book of a series by Richard Osman that began in 2020, and has released a new installment every year since, with a fifth coming soon. So, at baseline, the source material is definitely there, and the next film would be The Man Who Died Twice, or, The Thursday Murder Club: The Man Who Died Twice, as I think Netflix would want to make it clear to everyone that this was a sequel.
• Next, we have director Chris Columbus speaking to Film Stories early in August, where he seemed optimistic about a sequel even before the movie was released: “all signs seem to point” to “a sequel or the next chapter. Time will tell. It depends how many people see this film.”
• Well, moving forward, we know that The Thursday Murder Club *was* well-viewed on Netflix, holding the #1 spot for a little while, even over the enormous KPop Demon Hunters, Netflix’s most popular movie of all time. It’s still #2 right now.
• One wrinkle here is that the movie changed something significant from the book at the end that may have ramifications for the next chapter. I won’t get into it, per spoilers, though I doubt it’s enough for them to throw up their hands and abandon a sequel.
• The final issue may be cast availability. The four core members have three Oscars between them and may be too busy elsewhere to do another Netflix movie. Helen Mirren and Pierce Brosnan specifically are currently starring in Paramount Plus’s Mobland, one of that service’s most-viewed offerings, so they’d have to juggle that as well.
• Then there’s the fact that even well-performing movies often claim they’ll get sequels and then nothing really comes of it, as it seems hard for those to actually come to fruition on Netflix, even if the original was well-viewed. Sometimes this works out, other times not, and we just don’t know where the coinflip will land this time.

My best guess is that a sequel will be announced, but whether it makes it out is another story. It seems like it would be a good series to add to Netflix’s arsenal, but there are a lot of competing factors involved here, and we’ll just have to see.

Pick up my sci-fi novels the and .
summary: The Thursday Murder Club, a film based on Richard Osman's first book, has been well-viewed on Netflix and has received numerous requests from my parents. The sequel, likely named The Man Who Died Twice, may be announced as a sequel, but it is unclear if this would be called The Thursday Murder Co. Director Chris Columbus expressed optimism about a sequel before the movie was released. However, casting availability may hinder a sequel. The series is currently being developed with three Oscars between the cast.
shortSummary: The Thursday Murder Club 2, based on Richard Osman’s novel, has received mixed reactions from critics and potential cast availability issues, especially with upcoming releases.

scraped_sources.text:
The Thursday Murder Club has already proved to be a big hit for Netflix just days after its release.
After premiering on – when else? – Thursday, the movie adaptation of Richard Osman’s best-selling cosy mystery novel shot to the top of Netflix UK’s list most-watched films, undoubtedly helped along by its stellar A-list cast, led by Dame Helen Mirren, Pierce Brosnan, Sir Ben Kingsley and Celia Imrie.
But The Thursday Murder Club is only the first instalment in the book series by the former Pointless host, the latest of which is due later this year.
So, the question now remains… what are the chances of those books being adapted by Netflix in a Thursday Murder Club sequel?
Will The Thursday Murder Club get a sequel on Netflix?
At the moment, the streaming service is yet to make an official announcement about the future of the Thursday Murder Club series.
However, in the past, Netflix has been known to turn some of its flagship feature films into franchises, including Enola Holmes, Fear Street and To All The Boys I’ve Loved Before (a follow-up to KPop Demon Hunters, which recently broke the record for Netflix’s most popular original film ever, is also tipped to be in the works), so it certainly isn’t beyond the realm of possibility.
Speaking to Film Stories, director Chris Columbus admitted that “all signs seem to point” to “a sequel or the next chapter” in the Thursday Murder Club story.
He also told The Mirror when asked about a sequel: “Time will tell. It depends how many people see this film.”
And given the film’s near-immediate popularity with viewers, it’s looking very possible that we could be checking in with Elizabeth, Ron, Ibrahim and Joyce in the not-too-distant future.
What have the Thursday Murder Club cast said about a sequel?
Dame Helen has made it clear she’d be up for another outing as Elizabeth, telling Radio Times she’d do a sequel “in a nanosecond”.
“It would be the team getting back together, which would be great,” the Oscar winner added. “We did have a wonderful time shooting this. So all of us would jump at the chance, quite honestly.”
How many Thursday Murder Club books are there?
Let’s just say Richard Osman has certainly been keeping himself busy these last few years.
At the time of writing, four books in the Thursday Murder Club series have been released, the first of which came out in 2020, followed by 2021’s The Man Who Died Twice, 2022’s The Bullet That Missed and 2023’s The Last Devil To Die.
The much-anticipated fifth book, The Impossible Fortune, is due for release on 25 September.

Innehåll och annonser med anpassning kan även omfatta sådant som videorekommendationer, en anpassad YouTube Hem-sida och anpassade annonser utifrån tidigare aktivitet, till exempel vad du tittar på och söker efter på YouTube. Vi använder även cookies och data för att anpassa upplevelsen efter lämplighet för din målgrupp, om tillämpligt.

argos_summary: Netflix is considering a sequel to The Thursday Murder Club, with director Chris Columbus optimistic and cast members open to returning. The first film topped Netflix UK’s charts, suggesting strong viewership that could justify a follow‑up. However, cast availability and the need to align with the next book in the series, The Man Who Died Twice, pose potential hurdles. While Netflix has turned other films into franchises, no official announcement has been made yet, and the outcome remains uncertain.
